seasonal_patterns.spring: March-May: Focus on lighter snacks, fresh fruit options, outdoor eating promotions, spring break crowds, end-of-school-year events
seasonal_patterns.summer: June-August: Peak tourism season if applicable, cold beverages emphasis, frozen treats, beach/pool snack packs, summer camp catering opportunities
seasonal_patterns.fall: September-November: Back-to-school rush, pumpkin/seasonal flavors, football game day snacks, Halloween treats, Thanksgiving prep items
seasonal_patterns.winter: December-February: Holiday party platters, warm comfort snacks, hot beverages, Valentine's treats, New Year health-focused options then comfort food rebound

weekly_patterns.monday: Slow morning, picks up at lunch. Promote 'Monday Motivation' deals. Customers want comfort after weekend
weekly_patterns.tuesday: Steady day. Good for introducing new items - regulars are in routine. Meal prep crowd stops by
weekly_patterns.wednesday: Midweek slump - afternoon snack sales peak. 'Hump Day' promotions work well
weekly_patterns.thursday: Building toward weekend energy. Customers more willing to splurge. Preview weekend specials
weekly_patterns.friday: Highest sales day typically. Afternoon rush as people treat themselves. Stock extra popular items
weekly_patterns.saturday: Family traffic, leisurely visits. Brunch items perform well. Different customer base than weekday
weekly_patterns.sunday: Slower morning, post-church/brunch crowd. Prep-for-week sales. Close earlier if data supports

monthly_patterns.early_month: Days 1-10: Post-payday spending. Customers more willing to try premium items and larger orders
monthly_patterns.mid_month: Days 11-20: Steady baseline. Good time for loyalty program promotions and combo deals
monthly_patterns.late_month: Days 21-31: Budget-conscious customers. Emphasize value, promote smaller items, combo deals shine

peak_crisis_times.daily_afternoon_slump: 2:00pm-3:30pm when energy crashes and people need pick-me-up
peak_crisis_times.monday_morning_dread: 7:00am-9:00am when people need comfort to start week
peak_crisis_times.lunch_decision_fatigue: 11:45am-12:15pm when people can't decide on lunch and want quick option
peak_crisis_times.late_night_cravings: 8:00pm-close when dinner wasn't satisfying or studying/working late
peak_crisis_times.pre_meeting_stress: 30 minutes before typical meeting times when people want comfort food
peak_crisis_times.post_workout_hunger: Varies by nearby gym schedules - immediate need for protein/refuel

pricing_psychology.charm_pricing: Use $4.99 instead of $5.00 for individual items - proven to increase sales 20-30%
pricing_psychology.price_anchoring: Display premium $8.99 item first, makes $5.99 item seem reasonable
pricing_psychology.bundle_discount: Individual items $3 each, combo of 3 for $7.99 - saves $1.01, feels like deal
pricing_psychology.decoy_pricing: Offer small ($3), medium ($4.50), large ($5) - most choose medium, but large has best margin
pricing_psychology.round_numbers_for_luxury: Premium/specialty items at $6 or $8 flat - signals quality over bargain
pricing_psychology.loyalty_pricing: Every 10th item free creates $30-40 customer lifetime value for $3-4 cost

retention_hooks.punch_card_program: 10th item free - physical card creates commitment, 70% return rate vs 30% without
retention_hooks.name_recognition: Learn regular names and orders - personal connection drives 3x visit frequency
retention_hooks.surprise_delight: Random free topping upgrade for regulars - unexpected rewards create stronger loyalty than predictable ones
retention_hooks.exclusive_previews: Text regulars when testing new items for feedback - makes them feel like insiders
retention_hooks.birthday_club: Free signature item on birthday month - captures contact info, 85% redemption rate
retention_hooks.social_recognition: Feature customer of the month on social media - people love recognition, drives engagement
retention_hooks.quality_guarantee: If you don't love it, we'll remake it or replace it free - builds trust, rarely abused
retention_hooks.seasonal_anticipation: Limited-time items return same time yearly - customers plan around them, mark calendars

referral_strategies.bring_a_friend: Bring someone new, you both get 20% off - converts 1 customer into 2, cost-effective
referral_strategies.social_check_in: Check in on social media, get free topping upgrade - amplifies reach organically
referral_strategies.office_hero_program: Bring 5+ coworkers, yours is free - turns customers into sales people
referral_strategies.review_incentive: Leave honest review, get $2 off next visit - builds social proof while driving return
referral_strategies.sample_sharing: Give regulars extra sample cups to share with friends - word-of-mouth with proof
referral_strategies.catering_referral: Refer corporate catering client, get $25 credit - taps into networks you can't reach
referral_strategies.local_partnership: Partner with nearby gym/office - cross-promote, share customer bases
referral_strategies.gift_card_bonus: Buy $25 gift card, get $5 bonus card for yourself - recipient becomes new customer, buyer returns
